title: Gastrointestinal Stromal Tumour – Biopsy Specimens
scope:
The dataset has been developed for the pathology reporting of biopsy specimens for gastrointestinal stromal tumour (GIST). A separate ICCR dataset is available for reporting of resection specimens of GIST. Metastatic GIST specimens are excluded from this dataset. A separate ICCR dataset for soft tissue sarcoma is available.
The dataset has been developed for the pathology reporting of biopsy specimens for gastrointestinal stromal tumour (GIST). A separate ICCR dataset is available for reporting of resection specimens of GIST.
Metastatic GIST specimens are excluded from this dataset. A separate ICCR dataset for soft tissue sarcoma is available.

Gastrointestinal Stromal Tumour (GIST) Histopathology Reporting Guide – Biopsy Specimens . 1st edition . International Collaboration on Cancer Reporting; Sydney, Australia. ISBN: 978-1-922324-16-0. Read more on the Gastrointestinal stromal tumour dataset (1st edition) from the journal article written by the dataset authors: Dataset for reporting of gastrointestinal stromal tumours: recommendations from the International Collaboration on Cancer Reporting (ICCR) . Hornick JL, Webster F, Dei Tos AP, Hemmings C, Miettinen M, Oda Y, Raut CP, Rubin BP, Von Mehren M, Wardelmann E, Fletcher CDM. Histopathology. 2023 Feb;82(3):376-384. doi: 10.1111/his.14791. Epub 2022 Sep 20. Expert Committee The 1st edition of the dataset for Gastrointestinal stromal tumour (GIST) – biopsy specimens was developed by the following international team: Chair – Jason Hornick, Chair, USA Series Champion – Christopher Fletcher, USA ICCR representative and domain expert – Chris Hemming, New Zealand Domain experts: Angelo Paolo Dei Tos, Italy Markku Miettinen, USA Yoshinao Oda, Japan Chandrajit Raut, USA Brian Rubin, USA Margaret von Mehren, USA Eva Wardelmann, Germany

sections.title: Scope
sections.content:
The dataset has been developed for the pathology reporting of biopsy specimens for gastrointestinal stromal tumour (GIST). A separate ICCR dataset is available for reporting of resection specimens of GIST. Metastatic GIST specimens are excluded from this dataset. A separate ICCR dataset for soft tissue sarcoma is available.
The dataset has been developed for the pathology reporting of biopsy specimens for gastrointestinal stromal tumour (GIST). A separate ICCR dataset is available for reporting of resection specimens of GIST.

full_text:
Datasets Gastrointestinal Stromal Tumour – Biopsy Specimens

Datasets > Published Datasets > Soft Tissue and Bone > Gastrointestinal Stromal Tumour – Biopsy Specimens Scope The dataset has been developed for the pathology reporting of biopsy specimens for gastrointestinal stromal tumour (GIST). A separate ICCR dataset is available for reporting of resection specimens of GIST. Metastatic GIST specimens are excluded from this dataset. A separate ICCR dataset for soft tissue sarcoma is available. Gastrointestinal Stromal Tumour – Biopsy Specimens

The dataset has been developed for the pathology reporting of biopsy specimens for gastrointestinal stromal tumour (GIST). A separate ICCR dataset is available for reporting of resection specimens of GIST. Metastatic GIST specimens are excluded from this dataset. A separate ICCR dataset for soft tissue sarcoma is available.

The dataset has been developed for the pathology reporting of biopsy specimens for gastrointestinal stromal tumour (GIST). A separate ICCR dataset is available for reporting of resection specimens of GIST.

Metastatic GIST specimens are excluded from this dataset. A separate ICCR dataset for soft tissue sarcoma is available.
